<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a 
name="_AEIOULastRenderedPageBreakAEIOU2"></a><font style="font-weight:bold;font-
family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">SECTION 2 &#8211; FINANCIAL 
INFORMATION</font></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Item 2.02 Results of 
Operations and Financial Condition.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-
weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;text-indent:8.18%;"><font style="font-
weight:normal;">On August 4, 2016, Gastar Exploration Inc. (the 
&#8220;Company&#8221;) issued a press release announcing the Company&#8217;s 
financial results for the three and six months ended June 30, 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;A
copy of the Company&#8217;s press release, dated August 4, 2016, is furnished 
herewith as Exhibit 99.1 and is incorporated herein by 
reference.&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-family:Times 
New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;text-indent:8.18%;">In accordance with 
General Instruction B.2 of Form 8-K, the information presented herein under 
Item&#160;2.02 and set forth in the attached press release included as Exhibit 
99.1 to this report is deemed to be &#8220;furnished&#8221; solely pursuant to 
Item 2.02 of this report and shall not be deemed to be &#8220;filed&#8221; for 
purposes of Section&#160;18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended 
(the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;), or otherwise subject to the liabilities of 
that section, nor shall such information be deemed incorporated by reference 
into any filing under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Exchange 
Act.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:8pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a 
name="bm_8_K_Body"></a>SECTION 9 &#8211; FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND EXHIBITS</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Item 
9.01&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Statements and Exhibits.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:bold;font-family:Times 
New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;text-indent:8.18%;">(d) Exhibits</p>

furnished as part of this Form 8-K:</p>

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:10pt;;text-

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:10pt;;text-

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:10pt;;text-

<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:3pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;;font-
size:14pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:14pt;font-family:Arial;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">GASTAR EXPLORATION 
ANNOUNCES</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:14pt;font-family:Arial;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">SECOND QUARTER 2016 
RESULTS</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">HOUSTON<font 
style="font-weight:normal;">, August 4, 2016 - Gastar Exploration Inc. (NYSE 
MKT: GST) (&#8220;Gastar&#8221; or the &#8220;Company&#8221;) today reported 
financial and operating results for the three and six months ended June 30, 
2016.</font></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Net loss attributable to
Gastar&#8217;s common stockholders for the second quarter of 2016 was 
$18.1&#160;million, or a loss of $0.17 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;This compares to a 
second quarter 2015 net loss of $118.0<font style="font-family:Times New 
Roman;">&#160;</font>million, or a loss of $1.52 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted
net loss attributable to common stockholders for the second quarter of 2016 was 
$12.5 million, or a loss of $0.12 per share, excluding the impact of a $3.3 
million loss resulting from the mark-to-market of outstanding hedge positions, a
$2.0 million allowance for bad debt related to a third-party production 
purchaser&#8217;s bankruptcy and other special items as compared to a second 
quarter 2015 adjusted net loss of $10.1 million, or a loss of $0.13 per share, 
excluding the impact of a $100.2 million non-cash, pre-tax ceiling test 
impairment charge and a $7.8 million loss resulting from the mark-to-market of 
outstanding hedge positions<font style="font-family:Times New Roman;">.</font> 
(See the accompanying reconciliation of net loss to net loss excluding special 
items at the end of this news release.)</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Adjusted earnings before
interest, income taxes, depreciation, depletion and amortization 
(&#8220;adjusted EBITDA&#8221;) for the second quarter of 2016 was $6.8 million 
compared to adjusted EBITDA of $17.9&#160;million for the second quarter of 2015
and $10.7 million for the first quarter of 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;(See the 
accompanying reconciliation of net loss to adjusted EBITDA, a non-GAAP number, 
at the end of this news release.)</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a 
name="_AEIOULastRenderedPageBreakAEIOU2"></a>Total revenues were $12.2 million 
in the second quarter of 2016, a 45% decline from $21.9 million in the second 
quarter of 2015 and an 18% decline from $14.8 million in the first quarter of 
2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenues from the sale of oil, condensate, natural gas and 
natural gas liquids (&#8220;NGLs&#8221;), before the effects of commodity 
derivatives contracts, were $14.9 million in the second quarter of 2016, a 37% 
decline from $23.7 million in the second quarter of 2015 and a 3% increase from 
$14.5 million in the </p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">first</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;"> quar</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">ter of </font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">2016</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">.&nbsp;&nbsp;The reduction from second quarter of 2015 in oil, 
condensate, natural gas and NGLs revenues (excluding the impact of hedging 
activities) primarily resulted from a 54% decrease in equivalent production 
volumes offset by a 3</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">6</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">% 
increase in weigh</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">ted 
average realized equivalent prices. The </font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">increase</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;"> from </font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">first</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;"> quarter </font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">2016</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> 
revenues was due to a 112% increase in equivalent product pricing offset by a 
52%</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> decrease</font><font 
style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> in equivalent 
production volumes. On April 8, 2016, Gastar sold substantially all of 
its</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> producing assets and 
proved reserves and a significant portion of its undeveloped acreage in the 
Appalachian Basin for an adjusted sales price of $76.6 million (the 
&#8220;Appalachian Basin Sale&#8221;). As a result of the sale, </font><font 
style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">net production from the 
Appalachian Ba</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">sin 
area averaged 200 barrels of oil equivalent per day (&#8220;Boe/d&#8221;) in the
second quarter of 2016, compared to 7,700 Boe/d for the second quarter of 2015 
and 7,100 Boe/d in the first quarter of 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font 
style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Excluding the impact of 
Appalachian Basin production and </font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">the effects of commodity derivatives contracts, revenues from 
liquids (oil, condensate and NGLs) represented approximately </font><font 
style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">88</font><font 
style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">% of total production 
revenues in the second quarter of 2016, compared to 89% in the second quarter of
2015 and 85% in the </font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">first</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> 
qu</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">arter of </font><font 
style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">2016</font><font 
style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">.</font></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Commodity derivative 
benefits derived from hedge contracts monetized during the second quarter of 
2016 resulted in a $565,000 increase in revenues compared to a $6.0 million 
increase in revenue for the second quarter of 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the first 
quarter of 2016, Gastar monetized all of its put spread and other hedge 
positions covering the production months April through July 2016 for net 
proceeds of $3.1 million.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">During the second 
quarter of 2016, the impact of hedging on oil and condensates sales was an 
increase in the total price realized from $41.82 per Bbl to $43.59 per 
Bbl.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the second quarter of 2015, the impact of hedging on oil and 
condensate sales was an increase in total price realized from $47.68 per Bbl to 
$52.20 per Bbl.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">During the second 
quarter of 2016, Gastar allocated 15% of its oil hedges that were monetized to 
NGLs which resulted in an increase in the total price realized from $12.02 per 
Bbl to $12.62 per Bbl.&nbsp;&nbsp;In the second quarter of 2015, the impact of 
hedging on NGLs sales resulted in an increase in total price realized from $7.34
per Bbl to $14.97 per Bbl.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">During the second 
quarter of 2016, Gastar did not have any natural gas volumes hedged as a result 
of hedge monetizations in the first quarter of 2016 and the average realized 
price for natural gas production was $1.84 per Mcf.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the second
quarter of 2015, the impact of hedging on natural gas sales was an increase in 
total price realized from $1.10 per Mcf to $1.68 per Mcf.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">We continue to maintain 
an active hedging program covering a portion of estimated future production for 
July 2016 to December 2018, which is reported in our periodic filings with the 
U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;).&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;"><a name="_AEIOULastRenderedPageBreakAEIOU3"></a><font 
style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Average daily production
for the second quarter of 2016</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;"> was 6,400 Boe/d as compared to 13,900 Boe/d in the second 
quarter of 2015 and 13,200 Boe/d in the first quarter of 2016. Second quarter 
2015 and first quarter 2016 includes average daily production of 7,700 Boe/d and
7,100 Boe/d, respectively, attributabl</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">e to our properties in the Appalachian Basin, substantially 
all of which were sold April 8, 2016 in the Appalachian Basin Sale with an 
effective date of January 1, 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excluding the Appalachian Basin, 
oil, condensate and NGLs as a percentage of producti</font><font style="font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">on volumes were 71% in the second quarter 
of 2016 compared to 74% in the second quarter of 2015 and 71% for the first 
quarter of 2016.</font></p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">The following table provides a summary of Gastar&#8217;s total
net production volumes and overall average commodity prices for the three and 
six months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015: </p>

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant:
normal;">_____________________________</p>
<div align="left">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"  style="border-
collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.64%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-top:3pt;margin-bottom:0pt;font-size:9pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><font
style="font-size:9pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(1)</font></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-top:3pt;margin-bottom:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">The three and six months ended June 30, 2016 reflect the impact of 
the Appalachian Basin Sale completed on April 8, 
2016.</p></td></tr></table></div>
<div align="left">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"  style="border-
collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.64%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;font-size:9pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;"><font style="font-size:9pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">(2)</font></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">The impact of hedging includes only the gain (loss) on commodity 
derivative contracts settled during the periods 
presented.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:3pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a 
name="_AEIOULastRenderedPageBreakAEIOU4"></a>Lease operating expenses 
(&#8220;LOE&#8221;) were $4.6 million for the second quarter of 2016, compared 
to $7.2 million in the second quarter of 2015 and $6.1 million in the first 
quarter of 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excluding the Appalachian Basin, LOE decreased $1.2 
million, or 20%, to $4.5 million for the second quarter of 2016 from the second 
quarter of 2015 due primarily to a $1.6 million decrease in workover expense 
resulting from a decrease in workover activity and receipt of a $588,000 
insurance reimbursement related to 2015 activity offset by a $538,000 increase 
in controllable LOE primarily due to new West </p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:3pt;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">Edmond Hunton Lime Unit, or WEHLU, wells drilled in the second
half of 2015 and production enhancing operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;LOE per barrel of 
oil equivalent (&#8220;Boe&#8221;) of production as rep</font><font style="font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">orted was $7.86 in the second quarter of 
2016 versus $5.74 in the second quarter of 2015 and $5.05 in the first quarter 
of 2016, including workover costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excluding the Appalachian Basin
and workover expense, LOE per Boe for the second quarter of 2016 was</font><font
style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> $8.36 compared to $7.59
for the second quarter of 2015 and $7.93 per Boe for the first quarter of 
2016.</font></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Depreciation, depletion 
and amortization (&#8220;DD&amp;A&#8221;) expense was $5.6 million in the second
quarter of 2016, down from $16.1 million in the second quarter of 2015 and $13.7
million in the first quarter of 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;The DD&amp;A rate for the 
second quarter of 2016 was $9.59 per Boe compared to $12.74 per Boe for the 
second quarter of 2015 and $11.41 per Boe in the first quarter of 
2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decrease in DD&amp;A expense and the DD&amp;A rate was the 
result of a decrease in production resulting from the completion of the 
Appalachian Basin Sale coupled with a lower DD&amp;A rate due to impairment 
charges incurred in 2015 and the first quarter 2016 and lower full cost property
costs resulting from the Appalachian Basin Sale.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:3pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">General and 
administrative (&#8220;G&amp;A&#8221;) expense was $6.3 million in the second 
quarter of 2016 compared to $4.4 million in the second quarter of 2015 and $5.7 
million in the first quarter of 2016. G&amp;A expense for the second quarter of 
2016 included $702,000 of non-cash stock-based compensation expense, versus $1.2
million in the second quarter of 2015 and $1.6 million in the first quarter of 
2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excluding stock-based compensation expense, the higher G&amp;A 
expense in the second quarter of 2016 compared to the prior year period is 
primarily due to an allowance for a bad debt expense charge of $2.0 million 
related to a third-party production purchaser&#8217;s bankruptcy.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:3pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a 
name="_AEIOULastRenderedPageBreakAEIOU5"></a>J. Russell Porter, Gastar's 
President and CEO, commented, &#8220;Our secondary equity offering in May 2016 
yielded net proceeds of approximately $44.8 million, improving our liquidity 
position and allowing us to resume operated drilling on our extensive STACK 
acreage position.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have developed a drilling program of up to nine 
wells that will test the STACK potential across our northern acreage in 
Kingfisher County, Oklahoma as well as allow us to pursue a drilling program to 
de-risk our southern acreage in Canadian County, Oklahoma.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe
that drilling a select number of additional operated wells, coupled with the 
continuing success of offset operators developing the STACK Play near our 
acreage, should allow us to delineate and demonstrate the prospectivity of our 
acreage in multiple formations and confirm its value.&nbsp;&nbsp;Well data from 
our own operated wells, combined with data from the numerous non-operated STACK 
wells that we are participating in, should provide additional options for 
funding further exploration and development of the STACK Play.&nbsp;&nbsp;During
the remainder of 2016 and into 2017, we will continue to evaluate potential 
opportunities to partner with other operators or investors in a drilling program
to develop our undeveloped acreage, evaluate possible acreage divestments, or 
possibly raise funds in the capital markets to further </p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:3pt;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">enhance our liquidly and further fund the development of our 
acreage position in the STACK Play, which we believe is one of the most economic
plays in North America.&#8221;</font></p>
<p style="margin-top:3pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">Operations Review and Update</p>
<p style="margin-top:3pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-
style:italic;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">Mid-Continent</p>

variant: normal;">The following table provides a summary of Gastar&#8217;s Mid-
Continent production volumes and average commodity prices for the three and six 
months ended June 30, 2016 and 2015:</p>

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant:

<div align="left">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"  style="border-
collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.64%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;font-size:9pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;"><font style="font-size:9pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">(1)</font></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">Excludes the impact of hedging 
activities.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:9pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Net production from the 
Mid-Continent area averaged 6,200 Boe/d in the second quarter of 2016, which was
flat compared to the second quarter of 2015 and up slightly from 6,100 Boe/d in 
the first quarter of 2016. Second quarter 2016 Mid-Continent production 
consisted of approximately 48% oil, 29% natural gas and 23% NGLs.&nbsp;&nbsp; 
</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In October 2015, Gastar 
commenced flowback of its first operated Meramec well, the Deep River 30-1H, 
which in December 2015, produced at a peak 24-hour rate of 1,094 Boe/d (71% oil)
and has produced at a post-peak 230-day gross average daily rate of 513 Boe/d 
(53% oil).&nbsp;&nbsp;Gastar&#8217;s working interest in the Deep River 30-1H is
100% (NRI 80.2%).&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a 
name="_AEIOULastRenderedPageBreakAEIOU6"></a>In April 2016, Gastar&#8217;s 
second operated well testing the Meramec formation, the Holiday Road 2-1H, 
commenced flow-back.&nbsp;&nbsp;In June 2016, the well was equipped with a 
larger gas lift system and oil and natural gas production from the well 
continues to gradually increase.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the most recent 30-day 
period, the well averaged 267 gross Boe/d (81% oil) and 2,063 barrels of 
completion fluid.&nbsp;&nbsp;During the most recent five-day period the well 
produced at a gross average rate of 343 Boe/d (82% oil) and </p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">2,199 barrels of completion fluids.&nbsp;&nbsp;Gastar has a 
78.3% working (approximate 63.0% NRI) interest in the Holiday Road 2-1H 
well.&nbsp;&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">On June 20, 2016, Gastar
spudded its first operated Osage test well, the McGee 29-1H, with a projected 
vertical depth of approximately 7,600 feet and a 4,200 foot horizontal lateral 
in Garfield County, Oklahoma.&nbsp;&nbsp;Gastar&#8217;s current estimated 
working interest in the McGee 29-1H is 66.3% (NRI 53%).&nbsp;&nbsp;The estimated
gross cost to drill and complete the McGee 29-1H is $4.5 million, excluding 
costs associated with coring operations to evaluate the Osage and Woodford Shale
formations.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">To gather additional 
data on drilling and completing each of the prospective targets, year to date in
2016, Gastar has participated in four gross (0.5 net) completed non-operated 
Meramec Shale wells, one gross (0.2 net) completed non-operated well targeting 
the Osage, three gross (0.4 net) completed non-operated wells targeting the 
Oswego and one gross (0.1 net) completed non-operated Woodford Shale 
well.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">In the Mid-Continent, 
Gastar&#8217;s net capital expenditures in the second quarter of 2016 totaled 
$8.1 million, comprised of $4.3 million for drilling, completions and 
infrastructure costs, $2.8 million for unproved acreage extensions and renewals 
and $1.0 million for other capitalized costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;Year to date 2016 net 
capital expenditures in the Mid-Continent totaled $23.1 million, comprised of
$10.0 million for drilling, completions and infrastructure costs, $11.1 million 
for unproved acreage extensions and renewals and $2.0 million for other 
capitalized costs.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">For the remainder of 2016, Gastar&#8217;s capital expenditure 
budget is $38.1 million, comprised of $25.9 million for drilling, completion and
infrastructure costs, $9.2 million for lease renewal and extension costs and 
$3.0 million for other capitalized costs, resulting in a total 2016 capital 
expenditures budget of $61.2 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;Gastar&#8217;s capital 
expenditure budget remains subject to change based upon the commodity price 
environment and our liquidity position.</p>
<p style="margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
weight:bold;font-style:italic;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Appalachian Basin</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt;text-indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">On April 8, 2016, Gastar sold substantially all of its 
producing assets and proved reserves and a significant portion of its 
undeveloped acreage in the Appalachian Basin.&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table 
provides a summary of Gastar&#8217;s Appalachian Basin net production volumes 
and average commodity prices for the three and six months ended June 30, 2016 
and 2015:</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>

weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant:

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">_____________________________</p>
<div align="left">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"  style="border-
collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.64%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-size:9pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><font
style="font-size:9pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">(1)</font></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">The three and six months ended June 30, 2016 reflect the impact of 
the Appalachian Basin Sale completed on April 8, 
2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p></td></tr></table></div>
<div align="left">
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0"  style="border-
collapse:collapse; width:100%;">
<tr>
<td valign="top" style="width:3.64%;white-space:nowrap">
<p style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;font-size:9pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;"><font style="font-size:9pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">(2)</font></p></td>
<td valign="top">
<p style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;font-family:Arial;font-
size:9pt;">Excludes the impact of hedging 
activities.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p></td></tr></table></div>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Liquidity</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">On April 8, 2016, we 
sold substantially all of our producing assets and proved reserves and a 
significant portion of our undeveloped acreage in the Appalachian Basin for an 
adjusted sales price of $76.6 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;On May 12, 2016, we sold 
50,000,000 shares of our common stock in an underwritten public offering for 
approximately $44.8 million of net proceeds.&nbsp;&nbsp;At June 30, 2016, Gastar
had approximately $50.8 million in available cash and cash equivalents, $99.6 
million in borrowings outstanding and $370,000 in letters of credit issued under
its revolving credit facility.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">As of June 30, 2016, we 
were in compliance with all financial covenants under the revolving credit 
facility.&nbsp;&nbsp;We may, however, need to request a waiver of compliance 
with, or amendment to, certain of our financial covenants by year-end 2016, 
which may not be received.&nbsp;&nbsp;The absence of such relief could result in
significant adverse consequences and require us to pursue various 
alternatives.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
weight:bold;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Guidance for Third Quarter and Full-Year 
2016</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Our guidance for the 
third quarter of and full-year 2016 is provided in the table below and 
represents the Company's best estimate of the range of likely future 
results.&nbsp;&nbsp; Guidance could be affected by the factors described below 
in "Forward Looking Statements." </p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<td valign="bottom"  style="padding-left:21pt;padding-Right:3pt;padding-
Top:0pt;padding-Bottom:2pt;width:56.86%;">
<p style="line-height:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">Transportation, treating &amp; gathering ($/Boe)</p></td>
<td valign="top"  style="width:0.56%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-
indent:0pt;;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom"  style="width:23.16%;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$0.40
&#8211; $0.50</p></td>
<td valign="bottom"  style="padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0pt;padding-
Top:0pt;padding-Bottom:0pt;width:1.96%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-
indent:0pt;;font-family:Times New Roman;">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom"  style="width:17.46%;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$0.45
&#8211; $0.60</p></td>
</tr>
<tr style="height:12.95pt;">
<td valign="bottom"  style="padding-left:21pt;padding-Right:3pt;padding-
Top:0pt;padding-Bottom:2pt;width:56.86%;">
<p style="line-height:10pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;color:#000000;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-

general &amp; administrative ($/Boe)</p></td>
<td valign="top"  style="width:0.56%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-

<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-

<td valign="bottom"  style="padding-left:0pt;padding-Right:0pt;padding-

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-left:0pt;;text-
indent:0pt;;font-family:Times New Roman;">&nbsp;</p></td>
<td valign="bottom"  style="width:17.46%;">
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-
left:0pt;;text-indent:0pt;;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">$4.60
&#8211; $5.00</p></td>

</table></div>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:9pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:9pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Mid-Year 2016 Reserve 
Update</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">SEC proved reserve 
estimates as of June 30, 2016 totaled 32.8 MMBoe, of which 42% is proved 
developed, and were comprised of 19.7 million barrels of crude oil and 
condensate, 6.0 million barrels of NGLs and 42.2 billion cubic feet of natural 
gas.&nbsp;&nbsp;The pre-tax SEC-priced present value of future cash flows of 
these reserves, discounted at 10% ("PV-10") (a non-GAAP financial measure 
defined below in &#8220;Information on Reserves and PV-10 Value&#8221;), was 
$205.7 million, a 10% decline as compared to year-end 2015 as a result of lower 
proved reserve volumes and lower SEC prices.&nbsp;&nbsp;The proved reserves 
volume decline of 23.1 MMBoe, or 41%, is primarily attributable to the sale of 
approximately 14.1 MMBoe of proved reserves in the Appalachian Basin and a 
declining commodity price environment that has rendered some proved undeveloped 
well locations uneconomic.&nbsp;&nbsp;In accordance with SEC regulations, 
estimates of proved reserves as of June 30, 2016 were calculated using the 12-
month unweighted arithmetic average of the first-day-of-the-month price for each
month in the period July 1, 2015 through June 30, 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;For oil
volumes, the average West Texas Intermediate price utilized was $43.12 per 
barrel, compared to $50.28 per barrel for year-end 2015, and for natural gas 
volumes, the average Henry Hub price utilized was $2.24 per million Btu (MMBtu),
compared to $2.59 per MMBtu for year-end 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;These benchmark oil 
and natural gas prices were adjusted for energy content or quality, 
transportation and regional price differentials by area.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a 
name="_AEIOULastRenderedPageBreakAEIOU8"></a><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">For a discussion of PV-10 and the standardized measure of 
</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">future net cash flows, 
see "Information on Reserves and PV-10 Value."</font></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Conference Call</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:16pt;margin-top:9pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Gastar has scheduled a 
conference call for&#160;11:00 a.m. Eastern Time&#160;(10:00 a.m. Central Time) 
on Friday, August 5, 2016.&#160; Investors may participate in the call either by
phone or audio webcast.</p>

<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">For more information, 
please contact&#160;Donna Washburn&#160;at&#160;Dennard-Lascar Associates at 
713-529-6600 or e-mail&#160;<font style="text-
decoration:underline;color:#0000FF;">dwashburn@DennardLascar.com</font><font 
style="font-family:Times New Roman;">.</font></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-top:9pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">About Gastar 
Exploration</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Gastar Exploration Inc. 
is a pure play Mid-Continent independent energy company engaged in the 
exploration, development and production of oil, condensate, natural gas and 
natural gas liquids. Gastar&#8217;s principal business activities include the 
identification, acquisition, and subsequent exploration and development of oil 
and natural gas properties with an emphasis on unconventional reserves, such as 
shale resource plays. Gastar holds a concentrated acreage position in what is 
believed to be the core of the STACK Play, an area of central Oklahoma which is 
home to multiple oil and natural gas-rich reservoirs including the Meramec, 
Oswego, Osage, Woodford and Hunton formations. For more information, visit 
Gastar's website at <font style="text-
decoration:underline;">www.gastar.com</font>.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: 
normal;">Information on Reserves and PV-10 Value</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
weight:bold;;font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#auto;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a 
name="_AEIOULastRenderedPageBreakAEIOU9"></a>At June 30, 2016, future cash 
inflows were computed using the 12-month unweighted arithmetic average of the 
first-day-of-the-month prices for natural gas and oil (the &#8220;benchmark base
prices&#8221;) adjusted by lease in accordance with sales contracts and for 
energy content, quality, transportation, compression and gathering fees and 
regional price differentials, relating to the Company&#8217;s proved 
reserves.&nbsp;&nbsp;Benchmark base prices are held constant in accordance with 
SEC guidelines for the life of the wells but are adjusted by lease in accordance
with sales contracts and for energy content, quality, transportation, 
compression, and gathering fees and regional price differentials. The average 
</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;color:#auto;font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;"><font style="color:#auto;font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">benchmark base prices used in our June 30, 2016 SEC compliant 
reserves report</font><font style="color:#auto;font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;"> are significantly above current market commodity 
prices.</font></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#auto;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">PV-10 represents the present value, 
discounted at 10% per annum, of estimated future net revenue before income tax 
of our estimated proved reserves.&nbsp;&nbsp;PV-10 is a non-GAAP financial 
measure as defined by the SEC.&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe that the presentation of 
PV-10 is relevant and useful to our investors because it presents the discounted
future net cash flows attributable to our reserves prior to taking into account 
corporate future income taxes and our current tax structure.&nbsp;&nbsp;We 
further believe investors and creditors use PV-10 as a basis for comparison of 
the relative size of our reserves as compared with other companies.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#auto;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The financial measure most directly 
comparable to PV-10 is the standardized measure of future net cash flows 
(&#8220;Standardized Measure&#8221;) which takes into account future income 
taxes and our current tax structure.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of our current net 
operating tax loss position, no future income taxes are anticipated and the PV-
10 value shown should be reflective of our Standardized Measure.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#auto;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;color:#auto;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">The Company&#8217;s June 30, 2016 total 
proved reserves estimates were prepared by Wright &amp; Company, Inc.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
weight:bold;;font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
weight:bold;color:#auto;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Forward Looking Statements</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a 
name="_AEIOULastRenderedPageBreakAEIOU10"></a>This news release includes 
&#8220;forward looking statements&#8221; within the meaning of Section 27A of 
the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section 21E of the Securities 
Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.&nbsp;&nbsp;Forward looking statements give our
current expectations, opinion, belief or forecasts of future events and 
performance.&nbsp;&nbsp;A statement identified by the use of forward looking 
words including &#8220;may,&#8221; &#8220;expects,&#8221; 
&#8220;projects,&#8221; &#8220;anticipates,&#8221; &#8220;plans,&#8221; 
&#8220;believes,&#8221; &#8220;estimate,&#8221; &#8220;will,&#8221; 
&#8220;should,&#8221; and certain of the other foregoing statements may be 
deemed forward-looking statements.&nbsp;&nbsp;Although Gastar believes that the
expectations reflected in such forward-looking statements are reasonable, these 
statements involve risks and uncertainties that may cause actual future 
activities and results to be materially different from those suggested or 
described in this news release.&nbsp;&nbsp;These include risks inherent in 
natural gas and oil drilling and production activities, including risks with 
respect to continued low or further declining prices for natural gas and 
oil&nbsp;&nbsp;that could result in further downward revisions to the value of 
proved reserves or otherwise cause Gastar to further delay or suspend planned 
drilling and completion operations or reduce production levels which would 
adversely impact cash flow; risks relating to the availability of capital to 
fund drilling operations that can be adversely affected by adverse drilling 
results, production declines and continued low or further declining prices for 
natural gas and oil; risks regarding Gastar&#8217;s ability to meet financial 
covenants under its indenture or credit agreements or the ability to obtain 
amendments or waivers to effect such compliance; risks </p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">of fire, explosion, blowouts, pipe failure, casing collapse, 
unusual or unexpected</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> 
formation pressures, environmental hazards, and other operating and production 
risks, which may temporarily or permanently reduce production or cause initial 
production or test results to not be indicative of future well performance or 
delay the timing of</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"> 
sales or completion of drilling operations; delays in receipt of drilling 
permits; risks relating to unexpected adverse developments in the status of 
properties; borrowing base redeterminations by our banks; risks relating to the 
absence or delay in recei</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">pt of government approvals or third-party consents; risks 
relating to our ability to integrate acquired assets with ours and to realize 
the anticipated benefits from such acquisitions; and other risks described in 
Gastar&#8217;s Annual Report on Form 10-K, Quart</font><font style="font-
size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">erly Reports on Form 10-Q and other 
filings with the SEC, available at the SEC&#8217;s website at 
www.sec.gov.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our actual sales production rates can vary considerably 
from tested initial production rates depending upon completion and production 
techniques and o</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">ur 
primary areas of operations are subject to natural steep decline rates. By 
issuing forward looking statements based on current expectations, opinions, 
views or beliefs, Gastar has no obligation and, except as required by law, is 
not undertaking any obli</font><font style="font-size:11pt;font-
family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-transform:none;font-
variant: normal;">gation, to update or revise these statements or provide any 
other information relating to such statements.</font></p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Targeted expectations 
and guidance for the third quarter and full year of 2016 are based upon the 
current 2016 planned capital expenditures budget, which may be subject to
revision and reevaluation dependent upon future developments, including drilling
results, our liquidity position, a further decline in commodity prices, 
availability of crews, supplies and production capacity, weather delays and 
significant changes in drilling costs.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Unless otherwise stated 
herein, equivalent volumes of production and reserves are based upon an energy 
equivalent ratio of six Mcf of natural gas to each barrel of liquids (oil, 
condensate and NGLs), which ratio is not reflective of relative 
value.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our NGLs are sold as part of our wet gas subject to an 
incremental NGLs pricing formula based upon a percentage of NGLs extracted from 
our wet gas production.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our reported production volumes reflect 
incremental post-processing NGLs volumes and residual gas volumes with which we 
are credited under our sales contracts.</p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">- Financial Tables 
Follow &#8211;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-size:12pt;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">GASTAR EXPLORATION 
INC.</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">CONSOLIDATED STATEMENTS 
OF OPERATIONS</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:7pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;;font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<div>
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" align="center" style="border-
collapse:collapse; width:95%;">

<p style="text-align:center;margin-top:12pt;margin-bottom:0pt;text-

<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-
size:12pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<hr style="page-break-after:always;width:100%;">
<p style="margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-indent:0%;font-family:Times New 
Roman;font-size:10pt;font-weight:normal;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;"></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-weight:bold;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;"><a 
name="_AEIOULastRenderedPageBreakAEIOU13"></a><font style="font-
weight:bold;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal;text-
transform:none;font-variant: normal;">NON-GAAP FINANCIAL INFORMATION AND 
RECONCILIATION</font></p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:0%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;;font-
size:11pt;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:7.27%;font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial;font-weight:normal;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">We use both GAAP and 
certain non-GAAP financial measures to assess performance.&nbsp;&nbsp;Generally,
a non-GAAP financial measure is a numerical measure of a company&#8217;s 
performance, financial position or cash flows that either excludes or includes 
amounts that are not normally excluded or included in the most directly 
comparable measure calculated and presented in accordance with 
GAAP.&nbsp;&nbsp;Our management believes that these non-GAAP measures provide 
useful supplemental information to investors in order that they may evaluate our
financial performance using the same measures as management.&nbsp;&nbsp;These 
non-GAAP financial measures should not be considered as a substitute for, or 
superior to, measures of financial performance prepared in accordance with 
GAAP.&nbsp;&nbsp;In evaluating these measures, investors should consider that 
the methodology applied in calculating such measures may differ among companies 
and analysts.&nbsp;&nbsp;A reconciliation is provided below outlining the 
differences between these non-GAAP measures and their most directly comparable 
financial measure calculated in accordance with GAAP.</p>
<p style="text-align:justify;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:7.27%;font-family:Times New Roman;font-weight:bold;;">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="text-align:center;margin-bottom:7pt;margin-top:0pt;text-
indent:7.27%;font-weight:bold;font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;font-
style:normal;text-transform:none;font-variant: normal;">Reconciliation of Net 
Loss to Net Loss Excluding Special Items:</p>
